key_channel_insights.line_content: Price alignment reached 86.9% of itineraries, with ‘OTA Lower’ cases held to 1.2%, indicating low dilution risk via online agents.
71% of metasearch listings undercut the website by an average 7%, exposing the largest revenue gap despite a 6-ppt WoW improvement.
96% of fares price higher in the GDS, but the premium is only +0.24%; parity is inching up, now 3.7% of itineraries.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: 86.9% itinerary parity—up 4 ppt MoM—demonstrates tighter OTA price control.
‘OTA Higher’ fell to 7.6% (-3.7 ppt MoM), reducing customer sticker-shock risk.
‘OTA Lower’ remains marginal at 1.2%, keeping revenue dilution minimal.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Website fare missing in just 4.3% of ODs, flat MoM—distribution coverage largely complete.
Parity frequency rose 4.3 ppt MoM, covering nearly nine in ten itineraries.
Incidence of OTA-higher pricing cut by one-third MoM; average premium modest at +0.6%.
Undercutting stable and minor (-0.16% average), posing limited threat.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 77.9%; 15.2% of fares higher on OTAs—focus for further clean-up.
Parity 94.7%; OTA-higher just 1.2%, reflecting strong long-haul discipline.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: 94.3% parity, zero OTA-higher cases—benchmark for best practice.
Parity drops to 80.1%; OTA-higher spikes to 14.6%—overseas sellers drive misalignment.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Parity 86.2%; OTA-higher 7.1%, both improved ~3 ppt MoM.
Parity 88.0% but OTA-higher climbs to 8.6%—early-bird fares need tighter monitoring.

mse_highlights.line_content: 71% of listings cheaper on MSE at a 7% average discount—material leakage.
Same-price share grew 6 ppt WoW to 29%, showing early traction from corrective actions.
Long-haul and far-out bookings see 9–10% discounts, threatening premium segments.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Parity up 6 ppt WoW; further upside remains.
Share of cheaper fares fell 6 ppt WoW but remains dominant; average discount stable at 7%.
Zero cases of MSE-higher pricing observed.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: 83.7% of short-haul ODs cheaper on MSE (-5%); parity improving slowly.
59.8% cheaper with a 9% discount—priority area for action.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Undercutting at 54% (-5% avg); parity gained 11 ppt WoW—most progress seen here.
87% of itineraries cheaper on MSE (-8%); little change WoW—focus on overseas sellers.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 75% cheaper on MSE, discount 6%; undercutting eased 4 ppt WoW.
64% cheaper with a 10% gap; share of undercutting up 2 ppt MoM—monitor early sales.

gds_highlights.line_content: 96% of fares priced above website but at a minimal +0.24% premium.
‘Same price’ occurrences rose to 3.7%—tripled MoM—showing gradual alignment.
Only 0.3% lower fares in GDS—leakage risk virtually nil.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Parity up 35% WoW; progress steady but from a low base.
Lower-priced cases down 1.6 ppt MoM—minimal risk.
Frequency easing slightly (-0.9 ppt MoM); premium contained at +0.24%.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Parity 5.1%, premium +0.26%; alignment improving faster than long-haul.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Parity 1.8%, ‘GDS Higher’ 98.3%; no meaningful change WoW.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: 0–7 days: parity 5.2%, lower fares 0.5%, premium +0.25%—healthiest segment.
>21 days: 99.1% ‘GDS Higher’, virtually no parity; premium slightly higher at +0.26%.
